TextEng: No, stay here.
Yes, come with me.
No, never mind.
Yes, come with me.
Never mind.
I think we need to part ways.
Alright, fine. Stay with me, then.
Just stay here for the moment.
I'd like you to level up.
I want to change your tactics.
I don't want to change anything else right now.
I want to move faster and not bother with stealth or searching.
Text: 더 빨리 움직이고 싶어. 은신이나 탐색은 신경 쓰지 마.

TextEng: I need you to be stealthy right now.
Don't help me if I fail to open a locked door or chest.
Help me if I fail to open a locked door or chest.
I want to change the distance you stay away from me.
Text: 나한테서 떨어져 있을 거리를 바꾸고 싶어.

TextEng: Stay a long distance away from me.
Keep a medium distance.
Stay close.
Go ahead and attack as soon as you see enemies.
Defend me and don't attack until I do.
Text: 날 지키고 내가 공격할 때까지 기다려.

TextEng: I want to adjust your equipment.
Can you identify my equipment?
Text: 내 장비 감정해 줄 수 있어?

TextEng: I want you to use your Bard Song.
I need you to cast a spell.
Never mind.
No, that's it.
Ultravision.
See Invisibility.
Resistance.
Remove Disease.
Remove Curse.
Owl's Wisdom.
Neutralize Poison.
Mass Haste.
Mage Armor.
Light.
Invisibility Sphere.
Invisibility
Improved Invisibility.
Haste.
Ghostly Visage.
Fox's Cunning
Find Traps.
Ethereal Visage.
Energy Buffer.
Eagle's Splendour.
Clarity.
Cat's Grace.
Bull's Strength.
I've changed my mind.
Cast it on my animal companion.
Cast it on my familiar.
Cast it on me.
Cast it on yourself.
What was it you wanted to say earlier?
Let's stop and talk for a moment.
We're done talking.
How is everything?
I want you to stop calling me "<CUSTOM1001>".
I really don't care.
I don't know, but I've got a few names for you.
Text: 모르겠는데, 너한테 붙일 이름 몇 개는 있어.

TextEng: You will call me "miss", and that's all!
You will call me "sir", and that's all!
You can address me as "my <Lord/Lady>".
Call me "<Master/Mistress>"!
"The great <FirstName>" will do, I suppose.
Call me by my name. <FirstName>.
I want to discuss your training.
<StartAction>[Deekin will gain levels in the Rogue class]</Start> No, keep on working on your stealth for now.
Text: <StartAction>[디킨이 도적 직업으로 레벨을 얻습니다]</Start> 아니, 계속 은신 쪽으로 하자.

TextEng: <StartAction>[Deekin will gain levels in the Bard class]</Start> Yes, go back to improving your bard talents.
Text: <StartAction>[디킨이 음유시인 직업으로 레벨을 얻습니다]</Start> 그래, 음유시인 재능 키우는 걸로 돌아가자.

TextEng: <StartAction>[Deekin will gain levels in the Bard class]</Start> No, keep on doing what you are now.
Text: <StartAction>[디킨이 음유시인 직업으로 레벨을 얻습니다]</Start> 아니, 지금 하는 대로 계속해.

TextEng: <StartAction>[Deekin will gain levels in the Rogue class]</Start> Yes, try to focus more on your stealth and skills.
Text: <StartAction>[디킨이 도적 직업으로 레벨을 얻습니다]</Start> 그래, 은신과 기술에 더 집중해 봐.

TextEng: So what do you intend to do once this is all over?
Text: 이게 다 끝나면 어떻게 할 생각이야?

TextEng: The Dalelands?
The Dalelands is quite far away, you know.
So I gather.
Sounds like you've thought about this a lot.
Out of the caves?
You're a fool, Deekin.
I think you forget what kobolds are like.
Text: 코볼트가 어떤 존재인지 잊은 것 같은데.

TextEng: You bet!
So when do I get to see this 'epic story'?
Text: 그래서 이 '서사시' 언제 볼 수 있는 건데?

TextEng: Not a chance, kobold.
You'll have to chase after your own dreams, Deekin.
Maybe. We'll have to see.
It sounds like a worthy goal.
I highly doubt that.
And what makes you think I'll let you go?
Text: 내가 널 보내줄 거라고 생각하는 이유가 뭔데?

TextEng: Your dreams are a little too big, kobold.
Text: 네 꿈은 좀 너무 큰데, 코볼트.

TextEng: Oh? And what would you do if you met him?
Text: 오? 그래서 그를 만나면 뭘 할 건데?

TextEng: You can't just visit Elminster!
Well, no, he wouldn't eat you, I'm sure...
Text: 뭐, 아니, 널 잡아먹진 않을 거야...

TextEng: How about some entertainment?
Are you saying we're doomed?
So... do you know any good tales?
Hmmm. Maybe later.
Okay, tell me.
You don't say?
Count Fred?
Is there a point to this?
I'm beginning to like this story.
Uh-oh...
I think you need to die for that, kobold.
Text: 그 말 때문에 죽어야 할 것 같은데, 코볼트.

TextEng: I think part of my soul just died...
Text: 내 영혼 일부가 방금 죽은 것 같아...

TextEng: <StartAction>[laugh!]</Start> That's pretty funny, Deekin.
<StartAction>[groan...]</Start>
This is very gruesome, Deekin.
What's it about?
Tell me why you wanted your freedom from Tymofarrar.
Text: 티모파라르에게서 자유를 원했던 이유 말해 봐.

TextEng: Didn't you feel you owed Tymofarrar something?
Text: 티모파라르한테 빚진 게 있다고 느끼지 않았어?

TextEng: And what way was that?
I don't understand what you mean.
You? A dragon? Ha ha ha!!
So are you happy you left?
Tymofarrar told you that?
But you were so scared of Tymofarrar coming after you.
Text: 티모파라르가 쫓아올까 봐 그렇게 겁먹어 했잖아.

TextEng: But didn't you enjoy working for Tymofarrar?
Text: 티모파라르를 위해 일하는 게 즐겁지 않았어?

TextEng: I want to know how you became a bard, initially.
Text: 처음에 어떻게 음유시인이 됐는지 알고 싶어.

TextEng: But why did he select you and not another kobold?
Text: 다른 코볼트 말고 왜 너를 선택한 거야?

TextEng: Why would a dragon teach a kobold anything?
You were supposed to be the next chief?! Hah!
Text: 네가 다음 족장이 될 예정이었다고?! 하!

TextEng: Did Tymofarrar train all the chiefs like that?
So what happened?
Serves you right for not studying.
You poor creature! That must have been hard to take.
It must have been difficult keeping Tymofarrar happy.
Not many, I'd imagine.
Didn't you want to be chief?
Why not?
That couldn't have gone well.
But you didn't die, obviously.
It still seems like an odd choice for a kobold.
Yes, but why did he teach you to be a bard?
Text: 그래, 하지만 왜 음유시인으로 가르친 거야?

TextEng: <StartAction>[Reprimand Deekin.]</Start>
Well, I hope you learned a lesson.
Good enough. You're forgiven... for now.
Forget it! I'm through with you!
Not good enough! <StartAction>[Reprimand him some more.]</Start>
No, not just yet.
Yes, come with me.
Never mind that, just fall in line.
Text: 신경 쓰지 마, 그냥 대열에 합류해.

TextEng: You're just lucky I was able to turn you back.
Text: 널 되돌릴 수 있어서 운이 좋았어.

TextEng: You're certainly welcome.
Are you okay, Deekin?
If I were him, I would have just eaten you.
Text: 내가 그였다면 그냥 널 먹어치웠을 거야.

TextEng: Tymofarrar used to paralyze you? How horrible!
I'll have to remember that trick.
We kill her. Quickly.
Close our eyes, that's what.
I don't really know, Deekin.
I'm not sure, either.
Good question.
No. Just stay here for now, out of trouble.
Text: 아니. 일단 여기 있어, 말썽 피우지 말고.

TextEng: Of course...
It couldn't have been that long.
A couple of days at most.
Maybe we can find something to help us before then.
Text: 그전에 우리를 도와줄 뭔가를 찾을 수 있을지도.

TextEng: Of course I'm happy. Now I get to finally kill you!
Text: 물론 기쁘지. 이제 드디어 널 죽일 수 있겠어!

TextEng: Just how is it that I haven't seen you this entire trip?
Text: 이 여정 내내 어떻게 널 한 번도 못 봤지?

TextEng: No, the great hero is not happy to see Deekin at *all*.
Text: 아니, 위대한 영웅은 디킨을 보게 돼서 *전혀* 기쁘지 않아.

TextEng: Deekin? What are you doing here?
Forget it. I want you off this caravan... now!
Fine, then cook. And leave me alone.
Text: 좋아, 그럼 요리나 해. 그리고 날 좀 내버려 둬.

TextEng: Being a cook isn't being an adventurer.
Text: 요리사가 되는 게 모험가가 되는 건 아니야.

TextEng: You want to be an adventurer?
No. Not interested.
Sorry, Deekin. You'll have to find your own adventure.
Text: 미안해, 디킨. 네 모험은 네가 찾아야지.

TextEng: But I don't want some annoying kobold with me!
You want to write my story, do you?
Alright. Come with me, then.
You want to travel with me? Can you fight?
Text: 나랑 같이 다니고 싶어? 싸울 수 있어?

TextEng: Can you cast spells?
Can you at least carry stuff?
Forget it.
Right. Okay, you're in.
Quiet, Deekin. This isn't a good time.
Text: 조용히, 디킨. 지금 좋은 때가 아니야.

TextEng: Yes, Deekin? What is it?
It seems that way.
Don't turn coward now, kobold!
Why? Are you going to try something you'll regret?
Are you quite through, yet?
We're not going to die, Deekin.
Just make sure I get a copy of that epic tale.
Text: 그 서사시 사본 하나 받을 수 있게 해.

TextEng: Yes, well, you haven't been the worst companion, I suppose.
Thank you, Deekin. It's been an honor.
Don't be stupid. You'll die long before I fall.
Text: 바보 같은 소리 마. 내가 쓰러지기 훨씬 전에 네가 죽을 거야.

TextEng: Oh, I'm not going anywhere, Deekin.
Text: 오, 난 어디 안 가, 디킨.

TextEng: I'm sure you can finish the story without me.
Text: 너 없이도 이야기 끝낼 수 있을 거야.

TextEng: You'll get a chance to finish it, I'm sure.
Do you want to stay out of this fight, Deekin?
Don't think about it. You couldn't possibly understand.
Text: 생각하지 마. 이해 못 할 거야.

TextEng: Don't ask such stupid questions.
This is probably something completely different.
I don't intend on collecting anything.
Maybe. You seem to have paid more attention than I did.
Text: 아마도. 나보다 더 주의 깊게 들었던 것 같은데.

TextEng: The Tower of the Winds, right.
That's where Heurodis is, I suppose.
Stop that!
Gee. Thanks, Deekin.
You're not talking about the kind you smell again, are you?
Text: 또 냄새로 아는 그런 거 아니지?

TextEng: With Netherese magic, anything could be possible.
Text: 네더릴 마법이라면 뭐든 가능할 수도 있어.

TextEng: Three Winds might just be what these things are called.
Text: 세 바람이 그냥 이것들의 이름일 수도 있어.

TextEng: Deekin...
Stop bothering me with your prattle!
It's something Heurodis is doing, obviously.
Deekin...
Heurodis said that Undrentide would fly again...
Text: 헤우로디스가 언드렌타이드가 다시 날 거라고 했어...

TextEng: I don't want to talk about it.
Why are you asking this, Deekin?
I really don't care what you write, Deekin.
Text: 네가 뭘 쓰든 정말 신경 안 써, 디킨.

TextEng: Write that Drogan was a sentimental idiot who wasted his chance at power.
Text: 드로건은 힘을 얻을 기회를 낭비한 감상적인 바보였다고 써.

TextEng: Write that he died nobly and that we won't let his sacrifice be in vain.
Text: 그가 고귀하게 죽었고 그의 희생을 헛되게 하지 않을 거라고 써.

TextEng: Write that Drogan died as he lived: a hero. He won't soon be forgotten.
Text: 드로건은 살았던 대로 죽었다고 써. 영웅으로서. 쉽게 잊히지 않을 거야.

TextEng: Drogan was an old fool, that's what he was.
He saved us both, Deekin. Why? Is that so surprising?
Text: 우리 둘 다 구했잖아, 디킨. 왜? 그게 그렇게 놀라워?

TextEng: He sacrificed himself for me. You just happened to be with me.
Text: 날 위해 희생한 거야. 넌 그냥 나랑 같이 있었을 뿐이고.

TextEng: I could not care less, really.
Yes, I think he is.
He called it a mythallar, yes.
Keep your hands to yourself and don't get any ideas.
Text: 손 치워 두고 이상한 생각 하지 마.

TextEng: Someone either wants it or wants us not to have it.
Text: 누군가 원하거나, 우리가 갖지 못하게 하려는 거겠지.

TextEng: Let them come. And don't get cowardly, now.
Text: 오라고 해. 그리고 지금 겁먹지 마.

TextEng: Actually, we're going to them.
It hasn't happened so far.
You've got a point, there... I don't really want to be in danger.
Garrick seems to think the mythallar might be the key to victory, here.
Text: 가릭은 미살라가 승리의 열쇠일 거라고 생각하는 것 같아.

TextEng: You aren't thinking of backing out now, are you?
Bah! This is foolish talk!
Don't worry so much. I'll protect you.
Maybe a little. It's okay to be scared, Deekin.
No, I'm not scared at all. There's no reason to be.
Text: 아니, 전혀 안 무서워. 무서워할 이유가 없어.

TextEng: I'd love to go back to Hilltop, but how?
And give up the rewards that may be waiting for me? Never!
Text: 기다리고 있을지 모를 보상을 포기하라고? 절대!

TextEng: No. We've got to do what we can on our own.
Text: 아니. 우리 힘으로 할 수 있는 걸 해야 해.

TextEng: I'm not going to give the mythallar away! It could be useful!
Text: 미살라를 넘겨줄 생각 없어! 유용할 수도 있잖아!

TextEng: Never you mind about that.
It may hold the secret to great magical power.
Text: 거대한 마법력의 비밀을 품고 있을지도 몰라.

TextEng: But Drogan is far away, and I've no way to contact him.
Text: 드로건은 멀리 있고, 연락할 방법도 없어.

TextEng: We've got far more important things to do, Deekin.
Text: 훨씬 더 중요한 일이 있어, 디킨.

TextEng: No, we can't do that.
That could take a long time.
Probably.
Why? What do you know about it?
Poisoned him?
You feel guilty? I find that a little surprising.
I don't really need to hear any whining from you.
Why do you think you never fit in, then?
Are you really all that different from the other kobolds?
Text: 정말 다른 코볼트들과 그렇게 다른 거야?

TextEng: I thought you wanted Tymofarrar dead?
How convenient.
I'm not here to protect you, kobold.
Text: 널 지키러 온 게 아니야, 코볼트.

TextEng: No. Actually, in a strange way it helped us out.
Why do you even care?
Oh, yes, he was furious.
Why are you so interested?
So you know what it does?
Forget it. I'll find another use for it.
Go ahead, then. Make it into an amulet.
Can't you make it into something that would help me?
Text: 날 도와줄 수 있는 걸로 만들 순 없어?

TextEng: Make it into a dagger, then.
So this amulet would benefit you, right?
Text: 그럼 이 호신부는 너한테 도움이 되는 거지?

TextEng: <StartAction>[Lie]</Start> Drogan gave it to me. What's it to you?
Text: <StartAction>[거짓말]</Start> 드로건이 나한테 줬어. 그게 너랑 무슨 상관이야?

TextEng: Because I never gave it back to him, that's why.
Just don't run during a fight and I'll be happy.
Text: 싸우는 동안만 도망가지 마. 그럼 만족할게.

TextEng: Well, we're safer together, aren't we?
Text: 뭐, 같이 있으면 더 안전하잖아, 그렇지?

TextEng: If you're so free, why did you follow me?
Text: 그렇게 자유롭다면 왜 날 따라온 거야?

TextEng: Yes, I remember you blackmailing me into arranging that.
Text: 그래, 네가 협박해서 주선하게 한 거 기억해.

TextEng: Well, you're free now.
Perhaps it's your imagination which makes you different.
Text: 아마 상상력이 널 다르게 만드는 거겠지.

TextEng: It's good that you're worried, but Drogan came through it okay.
Well, it turned out Drogan recovered just fine, no thanks to you.
Text: 뭐, 드로건은 잘 회복했어, 네 덕은 아니지만.

TextEng: You're probably right.
I would have listened to you, Deekin.
You don't know that for sure.
Don't feel guilty. I didn't care about Drogan one way or the other.
Text: 죄책감 갖지 마. 난 드로건에 대해 어느 쪽으로든 신경 안 썼어.

TextEng: What did I tell you about calling me that?
Well, don't. Now be quiet.
Text: 뭐, 하지 마. 이제 조용히 해.

TextEng: What do you want, then?
Never mind that, let's go.
Yes, I brought you back... but you should stay here.
Text: 그래, 되살려 줬지... 하지만 여기 있는 게 좋겠어.

TextEng: Keep this up and I won't bring you back at all!
Text: 계속 이러면 다시는 안 살릴 거야!

TextEng: Forget it. You're staying here.
Fine, you can come along.
Just try not to die next time.
What did the voice say to you?
No, stay here for now.
Yes, come along.
